fields.name: Overview
fields.value: BASIC is a family of general-purpose, high-level programming languages whose design goal is to create programs that are simple to understand, and to be easy to modify or extend. BASIC was originally designed as a way to teach children to program, but it has since become a popular programming language for many years. It was created by John G. Kemeny and Thomas E. Kurtz in 1964.

fields.name: Features
fields.value:
- Easy to learn
- Very easy to understand
- Size is small
- Imperative
